0.Pros: Great crew to work with and management was great!
0.Cons: Not a lot of room for opportunities to advance.

2.Summary: "Great opportunities if you're willing to work"
2.Pros: Plenty of opportunity for advancement. I worked here for three years in high school. Been back for about a month and they're working towards getting me into management.
2.Cons: Have to deal with jerks. Most people are great and friendly but every now and again you get a real moron.

3.Summary: "It was good but the employee communication is terrible."
3.Pros: You make quit a bit of money if your in school and looking for a temporary job.
3.Cons: You might catch a lot of heat do to others mistakes.

4.Pros: it was ok to work here

5.Pros: I don't have much to complain about its a job
5.Cons: downsides at working at mcdonalds not enough hours

6.Summary: "My experience was cool at first then died out but maybe because I was in school and wanted better."
6.Pros: Free food, free drinks. Some good consumers, some good co workers, flexible hours. Tips from customers. Sometimes there are managers who look out for u
6.Cons: Some bad managers and bad consumers! Working on national holidays. No paid time off. If sick or can't make it you're treated badly. Rush hour...drive thru window and the head set u can barely hear from at times.

8.Pros: Easy to apply, not too difficult work
8.Cons: Customers are annoying, frying oil is gross, not a lot of pay

9.Cons: dont get alot of hours and is not where i want a career
